contents.subheaderText: A tool for Simple, Accessible, and Transferable Christian discipleship

contents.text: What is the relationship between God & man?

text.text: What is God's plan to restore our relationship?

contents.headerText: What is the relationship between God & man?
What is the nature of man?
What is God's plan to restore our relationship?
What is the purpose of the law?
How were people saved in the Old Testament?

revealedButton.text: Took our sin; gave us His righteousness

contents.headerText: God exists, and He created everything, including people who bear His image, to know Him personally.
As God, He is perfect and has a perfect standard that, as His image bearers, we have all failed to meet.
That imperfection, called sin, has caused us to be separated from the perfect God.
God knew this would happen from the beginning and set up a plan to show us our inability to make things right between us and Him.
The plan was to send His only Son to live a perfect life and, dying on a cross, to exchange our sin for His right standing before God.
All who repent and believe in Him receive eternal life.
Life now has new meaning, no longer to live for self but for God.

text.text: What does my time with God look like?

contents.text: Scripture 1.0 is not intended to answer all the questions you have about the Bible. Scripture 2.0 (coming soon) will address more reliability issues. What Scripture 1.0 is intended to do is to give you a picture, by looking at a lot of Scripture, of the benefits of reading Scripture and how it affects our lives. It is intended to help you to see the importance of digging into the Bible daily.
"The Bible is the inevitable outcome of God's continuous speech. It is the infallible declaration of His mind for us to put into our familiar human words."

revealedButton.text: Perfect; right; pure; equalizing; sweet; great reward for obedience
Affects every aspect of our lives

contents.headerText: What does my time with God look like?

contents.text: It is important to develop a consistent daily discipline of reading Scripture.

contents: Here are some questions to set you on the right track. To develop a daily time with the Lord, ask yourself the following questions:
When will you make time for reading?
Where are you going to do it each day?

altButtons.text: It may sound silly, but finding a distraction-free place is important

contents: What reading plan will you use?

altButtons.text: I suggest one that will get you through all of the Bible, not just the parts you like to read

contents: Are there resources you need to accomplish your goal?

contents.headerText: An exercise in walking in the power of the Holy Spirit.

contents: 1. Agree with God that I have wronged Him with my sin.
2. Agree with God about His provision for my sin.
3. Repent (change your mind, actions, and heart)

contents.text: Be filled with the Spirit to walk in light of God's forgiveness and empowerment.

contents: 3. Thank Him for His grace, forgiveness, and indwelling Spirit.

text.text: How can we develop a growing dependence on God through prayer?

contents: Prayer is conversation with God. It is our direct access to a loving Creator who is personal and accessible and who cares about our lives. Praying is not our access to some cosmic genie who grants our every wish. While God does desire to answer our prayers according to His will, His greater desire is for us to cast our cares upon Him and to increase our dependence on Him. Prayer is also not simply cathartic. Prayer is a powerful means of connecting with the heart of God and even seeing things change as a result.

revealedButton.text: Sometimes the answer is "No" for a bigger purpose
God delights to give the Holy Spirit

altButtons.text: Praise God for His goodness; honor Him for His holiness.
Help me to desire Your desires and to allow You to use me in whatever ways you think best.
Meet the needs I have today.
Ask forgiveness of sin; see where you need to forgive others.

contents.headerText: How can we develop a growing dependence on God through prayer?

contents: When will you make time to pray?
Writing down what you are praying for is a good way to look back on God's faithfulness.
Make a conscious effort to make prayer a part of your day, moment by moment.
Someone who learns how to grow, live, and express the Christian life and repeats the process with others.

contents.headerText: Jesus chose a few people to invest deeply in.
contents: Why is important to choose to invest in a few people?

altButtons.text: Because it is impossible to invest in everyone

contents.headerText: How do you choose whom to invest in?

contents.text: It is important to establish a solid Biblical foundation.

altButtons.text: Rightly handling the Word of truth

contents.text: It is important to show care for each other, modeling love, vulnerability, and service.
It is important to express the gospel beginning with those in your closest spheres of influence.

altButtons.text: Shared with those closest to her

lineTexts: To grow in your faith, there is no better place to turn than allowing the Bible to work in your heart. Scripture is the foundation for this material.

contents.headerText: The format of this material is simple:
contents:
1. Read the question.
2. Read what the Bible says to answer the question.
3. Discuss each question based on the Scripture given.
After each passage of Scripture, some hints are given to help guide the conversation and give an idea how each verse helps answer the question.

lineTexts: Transferable Discipleship is a tool for Simple, Accessible, and Transferable Christian discipleship.

contents: "Go and make disciples..." That is the goal. From my years of making disciples on college campuses, I have found great resources that work well from staff to student. After that, it becomes difficult to see discipleship continue to others. My goal was to figure out how to make discipleship Simple, Accessible, and Transferable.
The content is set up in a simple question-and-Scripture format. This way, a person can simply sit down with someone else, read through the questions, and see how the Bible answers those questions.

Sometimes, it can be difficult to know where to go to find the discipleship material you need. Then, when the person you disciple wants to disciple someone else, they may not know where to find what material you followed with them. Since this is a free app, it's available to everyone.

Jesus spent three years with a group of guys, and those eleven guys changed the world. They didn't keep what Jesus taught them to themselves, and they also didn't wait until they had it all figured out to begin helping others. This material is not all-inclusive, but it contains what I think are some of the most important concepts a Christian needs to grow in and share with others. It is intended for quick replication. After finishing the Basics and the Essentials, a person is challenged to use the Basics and Essentials to disciple someone else.
Found a problem? Want a feature? Other feedback?
